thread.title: Bengals Star Continues Holding Out Of Training Camp
thread.title_full: Bengals Star Continues Holding Out Of Training Camp

author: Timothy Lindsey
title: Bengals Star Continues Holding Out Of Training Camp
text:
(Photo by Frank Jansky/Icon Sportswire)
The Cincinnati Bengals are dealing with their own contract dispute with Pro Bowl wide receiver Ja’Marr Chase.
According to insider Dov Kleiman, Chase is not practicing at training camp for the second consecutive day as he awaits a new contract.
The three-time Pro-Bowler is now supposed to be the focal point of Cincinnati’s offense with former Pro Bowl running back Joe Mixon now on the Houston Texans.
Bengals WR Ja’Marr Chase is not participating at practice for the second straight day.
He’s currently seeking a new contract. pic.twitter.com/stDbsc7WtX
— Dov Kleiman (@NFL_DovKleiman) July 25, 2024
The reason why this is also such a big situation is because fellow Bengals wide receiver Tee Higgins, who is going to play on the franchise tag in 2024 after failing to earn a major extension this offseason, might be playing in his final season with Cincinnati.
Offensively, the Bengals cannot afford to lose both Chase and Higgins in the coming years, and if there is a decent chance that they could lose Higgins next year, they are going to need to go all-in on this season with the roster that they have.
It might be paramount for them to pay Chase right now so that he can get back on the practice field to catch passes from starting quarterback Joe Burrow.
The former Offensive Rookie of the Year in Chase has recorded three consecutive seasons of 125+ targets, 80+ receptions, 1,000+ yards, and seven or more touchdown catches.
It is hard to get more consistent than that.
What more does the Bengals front office need to see to convince themselves that Chase needs to be paid?
If they take too long to pay him, this issue could linger into the preseason and affect his feelings toward the organization in a negative way.
